bibl.title: Letter from J. Rafael Echeverria to H. Boyd Wylie, December 6, 1952

div1.p: Echeverria briefly describes to Wylie the memorial park at Camp Lazear, the ceremony associated with the dedication, and his pleasure at being able to take part in the ceremony.

div1.head: Letter from J. Rafael Echeverria to H. Boyd Wylie, December 6, 1952
div1.opener:
C O P Y
Havana, Cuba, December 6, 1952
Dr. H. Boyd Wylie.
Dean of the University of Maryland,
School of Medicine.
Baltimore, Md. U.S.A.
Dear Dr. Boyd Wylie:
div1.p:
According to your cable of November 26th, I had the
pleasure to assist to the acts in memory of those who intervened
in the experiments which conducted to the discovery of yellow
fever transmission.

A park in memoriam with the remains on Dr. Walter Reed's
Camp Lazear was inaugurated, and profiles of Finlay, Reed, Wood,
Lazear, Carroll, Agramonte and others, were devailed. Wreaths
were deposited by representatives of the United States and Cuban
governments as well as many leading institutions of both countries.
I deposited one in name of the University of Maryland under Dr.
Carroll's profile and expressed our sentiments and high
appreciation for being present at such act of remenbrance to one
of our graduates.

I am satisfied for this opportunity to be of any service to
the University for, nevertheless I have already retired from
professional activities after 35 years of a very intensive career,
could never forget our beloved Alma Mater where I received the
soundest medical knowledge and preparation.
div1.closer: I am, yours very truly, /s/ Dr. J. R. Echeverria Address: Calle E # 503. Vedado. Havana, Cuba.
